learning_outcomes.description: Solve a variety of first order and second order Ordinary Differential Equations (ODEs)
Derive properties of the hyperbolic functions and apply them in various mathematical contexts.
Understand and apply aspects of the theory of multi-dimensional integrals, using a variety of coordinate systems.
Apply differential calculus to the context of vector functions. Specifically, work with Grad, Div and Curl and understand their significance.
Apply integral calculus to the context of vector functions. Specifically, use surface and flux integrals, and the theorems of Green, Gauss and Stokes.
Understand and apply eigenvalues, eigenvectors and diagonalisation of matrices in a variety of contexts.
Apply concepts of orthogonality and inner product spaces to the method of least squares, best fit and function approximation
Model and solve problems with real-world application using mathematical techniques covered in this course.
Present clear and concise mathematical arguments in assignments and exams.

assessments.task_description: The assignment problems will cover material from the in-person and live-streamed lectures as well as the online-only lectures. It will be available from the course Blackboard page.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assignments must be submitted online via Blackboard. The submission link for each assignment and Electronic Submission Guidelines are provided on the Blackboard course webpage.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: The final examination in this course will be held during the end-of-semester examination period. The examination will be invigilated on-campus for students enrolled in in-person mode and invigilated over Zoom for students in external mode. You must attend the format allocated for your type of enrolment (in-person/external). Further details for each format will be provided to students before the examination period.
